availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.idno: Flat Storage Box: 11th Ky Cav (US) Muster Rolls, Bundle 1

body.p: Lt Col A. J. Alexander, of the 11th Regiment of Ky Vol Cavalry having applied for a certificate on which to ground an application for leave of absence ^withdrawl of resignation^, I do hereby certify that I have carefully examined this officer, and find that from a personal observation the he is suffring from Internal Hemorrhoids in a severe form, but by prompt treatment it is my opinion that he could be made able for field duty in Thirty- or Forty- Days He is under treatment now And that, in consequence thereof, he is, in my opinion, unfit for duty. I further declare my belief that he will not be able to resume his duties in a less period than
Dated at Louisville Ky., this 23d day of June 1864.

John A Brady
OH Surgeon U. S. A
In charge Officers Hospital

MEDICAL CERTIFICATE
IN THE CASE OF
Lt. Col. A. J. Alexander
11th Regt Ky Vol Cavalry
Given at Louisville Ky
BY
John A. Brady
ass Surgeon U. S. A
